subject: Self Care
title: Rest Is Not Laziness
description: One-minute skill: Rest Is Not Laziness.

hook.text: Resting feels guilty because productivity culture taught you that your worth equals your output. That's a lie.

buildup.text: Rest is not the absence of productivity. It's the foundation of it. Without rest, there is no sustained performance.

discovery.text: There are seven types of rest: physical, mental, emotional, social, sensory, creative, and spiritual. You may need all.

twist.text: Sleep alone isn't enough. You can sleep eight hours and still be mentally, emotionally, and socially drained.

climax.text: Identify which type of rest you need most. Then schedule it like you'd schedule a meeting. It's that important.

punchline.text: Rest is productive. Guilt about resting is the real waste.

quiz.question: How many types of rest are there according to the seven-rest framework?
options: Seven types: physical, mental, emotional, social, sensory, creative, spiritual
Rest is only about sleeping more
